case_vignette: A 48-year-old man is brought to the physician by his wife because he has become increasingly restless and anxious! His wife says that he has seemed sad and irritable for the past 4 months! He lost his job as a store clerk because he often lied to avoid work, and spent most of his days on the phone placing bets on football games! He avoids all family-related events because he has borrowed money from most of his relatives! He is hopeful that his symptoms will improve once he is able to win some of his money back! He previously smoked 8–10 cigarettes daily but quit 1 month ago! He drinks beer on the weekends! On examination, he is uncooperative and dismissive! He is mildly tremulous! Neurologic examination is normal! He is oriented to person, place, and time!
question: Which  is the most likely diagnosis?

multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Ask only one question at a time, and it should not be more than 1 line. Continue asking questions until you're 100% confident of the diagnosis. Do not ask the same question multiple times. Ask different questions to cover more information. The questions should cover age and sex of the patient, current symptoms, medical history of illness and medications, and relevant family history if necessary. Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain, only give the diagnosis name. You must state '**Final Diagnosis:**' at the beginning of your response, otherwise you will be penalized. You must give only 1 diagnosis otherwise you will be penalized.
Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
I've been feeling increasingly restless and anxious.
How long have you been experiencing these symptoms?
I have been experiencing these symptoms for the past 4 months.
Do you have any other symptoms like sweating, trembling, or increased heart rate?
Yes, I am mildly tremulous.
Have you noticed any specific situations or times when these symptoms worsen?
Yes, my symptoms seem to worsen when I'm dealing with family-related events.
Do you have any previous history of mental health issues or any family history of similar symptoms?
No, there is no mention of any previous history of mental health issues or family history of similar symptoms.
Are you currently taking any medication or under any treatment for these symptoms?
No, I am not currently taking any medication or under any treatment for these symptoms.
Final Diagnosis: Generalized Anxiety Disorder
